nl.tue.geometrycore.io

Class BaseWriter<TResult,TRenderObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.geometrycore.io.BaseWriter<TResult,TRenderObject>
  • Type Parameters:
    TResult - type of object returned on closing the writer
    TRenderObject - type of underlying render object, for custom rendering; see GeometryRenderer for more details
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, GeometryRenderer<TRenderObject>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IPEWriter, RasterWriter, SVGWriter

    public abstract class BaseWriter<TResult,TRenderObject>
extends java.lang.Object
implements GeometryRenderer<TRenderObject>, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    This class provides a base interface to write files that somehow store geometric shapes in a text-based format. Derived classes will allow writing specific file formats. General pattern of usage: 1. Construct a writer; 2. Call initialize(); 3. Draw geometries; 4. Call close(); After close, calling methods on an instance may cause unexpected behavior. Some writers may provide additional configuration options in between any of these steps. However, any settings must allow for default settings, making the above pattern a correct way of using the writer.

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the writer, by setting up a transformation from world to file coordinate systems. NB: any file-specific initialization should be handled here. Specific custom initializers should be optional.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • closeWithResult

        public abstract TResult closeWithResult()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Finalizes the writer, e.g. closing the file or sending its content to the clipboard. This should be the last call made to this object. NB: any other file-specific closing should be handled here. Specific custom closing handlers should be optional.
        Returns:
        object that represents the result; this may return null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
